seamonsters.motorControl¶

class seamonsters.motorControl.JeffMode(talon)[source]¶

Bases: seamonsters.motorControl.MotorSpeedControl

“Jeff Mode” is incremental position mode – it constantly increments the position of the motors to mock speed mode.

__init__(talon)[source]¶

Initialize JeffMode with a CANTalon. This will automatically zero everything and change the control mode – be careful not to change that later on.

getMaxSpeed()[source]¶

Get the maximum speed of the motor in encoder ticks per 1/50th of a second.

invert(enabled=True)[source]¶

Choose whether to invert the direction of the motor.

set(speed)[source]¶

Set the speed of rotation of the motor. This is the number of rotation ticks it moves every time update() is called.

setMaxSpeed(speed)[source]¶

Set the maximum speed of the motor in encoder ticks per 1/50th of a second.

update()[source]¶

Update the position of the motor. This function needs to be called in the main loop, 50 times per second.

zero()[source]¶

Zero the encoder target.

class seamonsters.motorControl.MotorManager[source]¶

Bases: object

A motor manager manages many CANTalons, with associated MultiMode’s. The MultiMode can be in voltage, speed, or jeff/position mode. The drive mode and maximum velocity of all can be set at once.

__init__()[source]¶
addMotor(talon, inverted=False)[source]¶

Adds a CANTalon to the manager. Creates a corresponding MultiMode, set to the current max velocity, drive mode, and specified invert setting. This MultiMode is returned.

getDriveMode(mode)[source]¶

Get the drive mode that was last set.

getMaxSpeed()[source]¶

Get the last set max speed.

setDriveMode(mode)[source]¶

Set the drive mode of all MultiMode’s, using constants from seamonsters.drive.DriveInterface.DriveMode. Default is VOLTAGE.

setMaxSpeed(speed)[source]¶

Set the maximum speed of SpeedModes and JeffModes.

class seamonsters.motorControl.MotorSpeedControl[source]¶

Bases: object

An abstract interface for controlling the speed of a motor. Keeps track of and controls a singe CANTalon.

set(speed)[source]¶

Set the speed of the motor, on a scale of -1 to 1.

update()[source]¶

This method is implementation specific, and should be called in the main loop, 50 times per second.

zero()[source]¶

This method is implementation specific, and should be called whenever you haven’t called update() within the past main loop iteration. For example, in JeffMode it will zero the encoder targets.

class seamonsters.motorControl.MultiMode(talon, speedControl)[source]¶

Bases: seamonsters.motorControl.MotorSpeedControl

An implementation of MotorSpeedControl that wraps another MotorSpeedControl implementation. All interface calls go to that object. This allows switching out the underlying MotorSpeedControl. Implementation.

__init__(talon, speedControl)[source]¶

Initialize with a talon and initial MotorSpeedControl. The zero() method of speedControl will be called.

getSpeedControl()[source]¶

Set the current MotorSpeedControl implementation.

set(speed)[source]¶
setSpeedControl(speedControl)[source]¶

Set the current MotorSpeedControl implementation. The zero() method will be called.

update()[source]¶
zero()[source]¶
class seamonsters.motorControl.SpeedMode(talon)[source]¶

Bases: seamonsters.motorControl.MotorSpeedControl

A CANTalon in speed mode.

__init__(talon)[source]¶
getMaxSpeed()[source]¶

Get the maximum speed of the motor in encoder ticks per 1/50th of a second.

invert(enabled=True)[source]¶

Choose whether to invert the direction of the motor.

set(speed)[source]¶
setMaxSpeed(speed)[source]¶

Set the maximum speed of the motor in encoder ticks per 1/50th of a second. The value passed to the CANTalon will be this value multiplied by 5, because the CANTalon uses units of encoder ticks per 1/10th of a second.

update()[source]¶
zero()[source]¶

Bases: seamonsters.motorControl.MotorSpeedControl

A CANTalon in voltage mode (actually PercentVbus).

Choose whether to invert the direction of the motor.
